item.title: The Incredible DROID INCREDIBLE
item.description: Android phones are constantly improving, aiming to surpass the leading Apple iPhone. The newest contender in the Google versus Apple battle is the impressive DROID INCREDIBLE. This HTC phone, available through Verizon Wireless, runs on the Android 2.1 operating system and offers customization with numerous apps and widgets from the Android marketplace. Its internal features are equally remarkable. One standout feature is the 8-megapixel digital camera and camcorder, with resolution comparable to standalone digital cameras.

item.title: Get After Christmas Cash From Old Gadgets
item.description: The holiday season brings joy and new gadgets, but also the dreaded credit card bills come January. Need some extra cash to counter those expenses? Consider selling your old electronics! It’s a win-win: you earn money and declutter your home. While you enjoy your new devices, those older models they replaced can be turned into cash. You might be tempted to keep old devices “just in case,” but realistically, when was the last time you actually used an older model after upgrading?

item.title: Unlimited International Landline Calls
item.description: We all know international calls can be pricey, making internet calls very appealing. As long as it’s computer-to-computer, you only pay for your internet service. But what if you want to use your regular phone line or cell phone? Is unlimited calling for a low fixed price even possible? Now it is. IBNtel Unlimited Long Distance is a new service that works with your existing phones â€“ no computer needed. It offers unlimited international long distance calling.

item.title: Get Paid To Celebrate National Cell Phone Recycling Week
item.description: It’s National Cell Phone Recycling Week, and there’s a way to make some money while participating! This initiative, spearheaded by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), highlights the importance of recycling valuable and potentially harmful materials found in cell phones. Wireless carriers and various retailers are accepting old cell phones to ensure these devices are properly processed and their components are reused in new products. By taking part, you contribute to environmental protection by preventing hazardous materials from ending up in landfills.

item.title: Cell Phone Wireless Broadband
item.description: Cell phones today are capable of much more than just voice calls. The mobile networks have evolved to carry both voice and data, offering wireless broadband internet access that rivals DSL and cable connections. If you haven’t explored mobile internet recently, you might be surprised by its speed and availability. Currently, two competing systems are widely available, with two even faster networks in their early stages. AT&T promotes its HSDPA and EDGE networks, notably featuring the Apple iPhone.
